alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 01 at 9:42AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central New Mexico, including the following counties, De Baca County and Guadalupe County. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered showers and thunderstorms will continue across eastern portions of the area. Antecedent wet soil conditions over the region along with high rainfall rates from storm activity will result in an elevated risk of flash flooding. The heavy rainfall threat will persist into the evening, keeping the flash flood risk over the area. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
